meanings.definition: The way in which something is arranged or set out.
meanings.sent1: The different formats of the books on the shelf make it easy to find the one you want.
meanings.sent2: She preferred the digital formats of magazines over the print versions.
meanings.sent3: The party invitations were sent out in unique formats to surprise the guests.
meanings.sent4: His mind works in mysterious formats, always coming up with new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful formats to help the students remember the information better.

meanings.sent1: The seating formats in the classroom were changed to encourage group work.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to adopt a new marketing format for their products.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle had a tricky format that made it challenging to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her schedule followed a strict format to ensure she stayed organized.
meanings.sent5: The garden's layout followed a unique format that impressed visitors.

meanings.definition: To arrange or set out in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: She formats her essays with clear headings and subheadings.
meanings.sent2: The team will format the data into a comprehensive report for the meeting.
meanings.sent3: He formats his workspace with everything in its place for maximum efficiency.
meanings.sent4: The artist formats the colors on the canvas to create a harmonious composition.
meanings.sent5: They format the text in the document to make it easier to read and understand.
